𓄛 ⋍ 𓄜 Tier 𓂧 𓂋 𓄛 ⋍ tail 𓎫 𓄢
𓄝 𒋾 𒊏 ti'rah₂ tear "to shoot an arrow" <> 𓌕 tîr 𒉼 tir তীর tīr <> 𓏱 (mor)tuer? 𓄛 δέρας 𓂧 𓁷 𓂋 𓄛 le'der чкъор dçer 𓆓𓎛𓂋𓄜 leather dermis > 𓄟𓂓𓄛 चर्म carmis
𓄛 δέρμα ŧiřməšŧ ⇔ 𓄟𓂓𓄛
𓄛 Tier θήρ Ther deri deer dēor dýr dyr 𓄜 只 zhīr dirij = tailr 𓄜 > σούρα
𓄛 τάρι as in 𓌳 𓄿 𓇋 𓃬 𓄛 λιοντάρι liontári /dari/ 'diminutive' 𓄛 тире tire > corium 𓐍𓆼𓄿𓅱 چرم čarm (skin)

𓂧𓂋𓄛 ćir 𒅔 gir₁₂ 𒁽𒁽 gir² 𒉾 gilim₂ Getier 𓄜 Tier "animate things, rodent, (wild) animals, moving things" 𓂧𓂋𓄛 ćir 𒅔 gir₁₂ грызу́н gryzún grauzējs "rodent" 𓂧𓂋𓄛 ćir 𒅔 gir₁₂ կրծող krcoł krigner Kriecher Kreuchvieh "rodent" 𓂧𓂋𓄛 ćir 𒅔 gir₁₂ قَارِض qāriḍ قَوَارِض qawāriḍ "rodent" 𓂧𓂋𓄛 ćir 𒅔 gir₁₂ гризач grizač "rodent" гло̀да̄р глодавац 𓂧𓂋𓄛 ćir 𒅔 gir₁₂ 𒁽𒁽 girˢgir karraskari squirrel "rodent" 𓂧𓂋𓄛 ćir 𒅔 gir₁₂ 𒉌ni@gir₁₂ Nager Nagetier nagdýr gnaver "gnawer" rīroi roseadôr rongeur "rodent" 𓂧𓂋𓄛 ćir 𒅔 gir₁₂ creature creimire кимерүче kimerüçe कृंतक kŕntak "rodent" <> 𓂧𓂋𓄛 τρωκτικό troktikó "rodent"

𓄟𓂓𓄛 մաշկ, կաշ mašk kaši 𒋢 KUŚ:skins цəа კანი askɑni skin masker > 𓂓𓄛 կեղեւ kɛʁɛv < dçer 𓆓𓎛𓂋𓄜

𓌕 ⋍ 𒁁 ⋍ 𒍗 ⋍ 𒌀 ⋍ 𒋾 TIL til₃ tîr (Alternative forms)
𓌕𓄜𓄝 ζoo.tîr 𒉼 tir তীর tīr ⇔ shooter 𓋴 𓄝 𓏏 𓌕

By the end of the Old Kingdom, the classifier was suddenly extended to the classification of living animals that “have (?) hide & tail”. Starting with the lion.

In the Middle Kingdom, the extension into the “animate” animals became a clear tendency in the script, with dog, cat, mouse, as well hippo and pig, getting the , and being all recorded also in lapidary hieroglyphic inscriptions as well as in cursive script and hieratic.
The category is extended by the new Kingdom to include many members that have no hide or no tail, or both, such as frogs. clear examples are the scorpion or the turtle.

the egyptian script system always keeps the parallel option to classify an animal by repeater (silent/specifying determinant) or unique, or both by repeater and the generic hide &tail.

By the end of the new Kingdom it seems that the generic category hide & tail starts to be further extended, to occasionally include also birds – thus moving towards the higher generic concept animal.

𓄛 Tier ⇔ 𓅲𓅂 tyw طير ṭīr 鸟 𓇋𓇋
